intro: Lathyrus aphyllus, commonly known as the naked-stem larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant is characterized by its slender, leafless stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. Its flowers are borne in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. Lathyrus aphyllus is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
